title: Is the advice on https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/999055 up to date on FF 87.0 on Windows 10?
content:
I have Googled up advice on searching my bookmarks collection. I seem to get into obsolete advice -- not all Google finds have dates on them. And it is unusual to find a heading that gives a date or the relevant FireFox release number.

It's difficult to summon faith that reading a Googled-up item will get you anywhere with FF 87.0.

I hit the star yesterday on a page about urging R to read in .xls files. It SEEMS to me that the bookmarks USED TO BE added in pushdown order. But my xls bookmark was not showing near the top of what I BELIEVE is the list of all my starred pages. "xls" doesn't seem to work as a search term. But I am unsure whether I have correctly invoked any kind of search: no sort of result appeared.

A more general observation: the advice I have see this afternoon seems BURDENED by a wealth of assumed knowledge and usage. One symptom of this is the abundance of references to unlabeled "bars".
creator: kerr262

title: Bookmarks maliciously being duplicated. How to fix this bug?
content:
Good afternoon support,

My bookmarks are being maliciously duplicated in some instances upwards of x7 times per bookmark.

This has skyrocketed the total number of bookmarks saved in excess of 100K+ with the current html file size 67,432kb up from 13,000kb on average which was still over-arched but a work in progress.

Steps Ive taken to date thinking it might resolve this nuisance to no avail include:

- Created a new firefox account - uploaded the previous html file - used various: 

                        - computers (hp, acer, asus, lenovo)                         - versions of firefox as well as freshed firefox                         - windows & linux                         - alternative web browsers due to frustration ie. chrome, chromium, opera,                          brave (c'mon at least im honestÂ :) but am not a fan of their product in                          comparison to firefox so I am determined to make firefox work in my favour

- Manually edit, and delete the duplicates on a daily basis but lone behold they return with a vengance. The system usually freezes for a few seconds or minutes, but just last night it was instant with no lag then bsod.

I'm beyond frustrated and totally annoyed with all the wasted time and effort.

Anyguidance is much appreciated.

Thank you

title: Firefox not working
content:
Firefox is simply not working. This error has been been there for last half hour. I tried purge-reinstalling it, restarting the PC but no use. Only thing I can do is open or close new tab or window, no searching works, not refresh button, not bookmarks, not preferences. Nothing is working. Even on-device html files are not showing.

OS: Ubuntu 18.4.5 LTS Firefox Version: 87.0 (Build: 87.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.2)

Only features working:

  • Open / close new tab / window, new private tab / window
  • Zoom controls (but there's nothing to see, so I just see the numbers changing)
  • View Bookmarks (only through the library popup and the links don't open)
  • View History (only through the library popup and the links don't open)
  • Troubleshooting Information page [about:support] (I've included the data)
  • Refresh Firefox
  • Restart with Add-ons disabled / Clear startup cache (Closes firefox but idk if it actually did anything, then crashes when restarting firefox.
  • About Firefox
  • Crashes page [about:crashes] (I managed to report 2 recent crashes)

PS: I just tried reverting to only other version available on Ubuntu (59.0.2+build1-0ubuntu1) and it doesn't work either. Screenshots and Troubleshooting Info attached for this version also.

title: Firefox won't open anything
content:
Firefox 87.0 (64-bit) on Ubuntu 20.10 is currently unusable as it won't open anything.

  • Firefox opens with no page loaded.
  • Clicking the single "getting started" bookmark does nothing.
  • Entering a search term in the address bar and pressing 'enter' changes the url in the address bar but nothing is loaded and the page remains blank. There is no indication that anything is loading.
  • Entering a url, such as "www.youtube.com", and pressing "enter" does nothing. There is no indication that anything is loading.
  • Opening the menu by clicking on the burger icon, then on "preferences" does nothing except make the menu disappear (same with most of the options in the menu).

In the browser console I see some errors and no request info (see screenshot).

I've tried `sudo apt purge firefox` then installing again, which didn't help. The problem started with ubuntu 20.04 (I only updated to 20.10 to see if it might resolve this problem).

I've tried the "refresh firefox" option, starting in safe mode, and clearing the startup cache, which didn't help.

Any suggestions would be much appreciated.

title: Clearing history disables all addons.
content: There is this odd thing happening with the Firefox for the past few days. My browser is set to forget history when I close it so now, every time I open the browser my addons are gone from the bar. When I check them in add-ons they are all there but none is working/active. For all these years I had the Firefox browser(windows) I never had an issue. I have manually for so many times: - disabled/enabled addons one by one. - Tried ruling out buggy addons. - refreshed the browser (most times without a success). -> The only thing that seems to do the trick is completely re-installing the browser with removing all residue folders prior to that. And signing in to sync the account. But this is only a temporary solution as when I clear the history its all gone again and the merry-go-around starts again. Ironically I never had Facebook container working in Firefox but now suddenly its working - that is when addons are back. I installed a new ssd with clean os installation last night, however, the very same issue was happening on my previous Firefox installation on previous ssd. I have simply no clue as to what is happening here. Anyone else experiencing this? I mean this is extremely annoying and as much as I dislike Chrome I might need to go back there. I really liked how Firefox worked up until two-three days ago. Firefox version: 87.0 so it should be up-to-date.
creator: anelishka

title: Address bar background has orange stripes with a robot icon
content:
This just started occurring on my PC when I use Firefox: why is the background of the address bar orange/yellow with diagonal stripes and there is a robot at the start of the web address? I'm concerned it may be a virus or the web browser is being remotely monitored.

Please refer to the attached image. Thank you,
creator: SurlynSalsa

title: Missing Backspace functionality
content:
Why did Firefox developers simply disable "Backspace" instead of making it a selection in "Settings"? I understand why some users can't stay "focused" and lose typed data, but the rest of us really like the backspace function to go back a page.

Yes you can re-enable it (& I did so) using "About:Config" but that's akin to REGEDIT and not for the faint of heart...

Am I going to have to make this edit every time FF Updates? and on each of my PCs?
creator: glenktn
